data.title: Scandinavia: surface area
data.meta_description: The largest of the three Scandinavian countries is Norway, with a surface of 625,222 square kilometers, when including the arctic islands of Svalbard and Jan Mayen.
data.text:
Surface area of the Scandinavian countries

Published by

Surface area of the Scandinavian countries (in square kilometers)

table column chart

CharacteristicSurface area in square kilometersNorway*625,222Sweden447,430Greenland****410,450Denmark**42,920Faroe Islands***1,396

Source

Release date

May 2022

More information

Region

Denmark, Iceland, Norway, Sweden

Survey time period

2018

Special properties

Scandinavia defined by the historic-lingustic aspect which excludes the Nordic countries of Finland and Iceland

Supplementary notes

* Includes Svalbard and Jan Mayen.

** Excludes Faroe Islands and Greenland.

*** Faroe Islands is an autonomous country within the Kingdom of Denmark.

****Greenland is an autonomous country under the Kingdom of Denmark. The area given here only includes the ice-free area, Greenland's total size is 2.67 million square kilometers.
